org.simulationsystems.csf.sim.core.api

Class SimulationRunContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.simulationsystems.csf.common.csfmodel.context.AbstractContext
      • org.simulationsystems.csf.common.csfmodel.context.CsfRunContext
        • org.simulationsystems.csf.sim.core.api.SimulationRunContext

  • public class SimulationRunContext
extends CsfRunContext
    Provides the context for the Common Simulation Framework. Adapter developers should instantiate this class first before the Simulation-Toolkit-specific Context object.
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Jorge Calderon

        public java.lang.Object getSimulationToolContext()
        Convenience method to return the context of the Simulation Software. For example, for Repast Simphony, this method would return a repast.simphony.context.Context
        Returns:
        the simulation tool context

      • mapSimulationSideAgent

        public void mapSimulationSideAgent(java.lang.Object simulationAgent)
        After the Simulation and Common Framework are initialized, the Simulation Adaptor API (or child class) is initialized, and prior to executing a simulation run, this method must be called to configure the simulation-side of the AgentMappings for one type (class) of simulation agent. If multiple agent classes are distributed, this method must be called for each type. This is done prior to the distributed agent-side mappings. Use this method to send a single Simulation Agent object.
        Parameters:
        simulationAgent - the simulation agent

      • mapSimulationSideAgents

        public void mapSimulationSideAgents(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Object> agentsOfOneType)
        Map simulation side agents.
        Parameters:
        agentsOfOneType - the agents of one type
